name: Glycerin

phaseTransitions.decompositionNote: Decomposes above 290°C; rarely heated to boiling

criticalPoint.note: Critical point not measured due to decomposition

safetyNotes: Generally safe; non-toxic; sweet taste; can be ingested in small amounts; hygroscopic (absorbs moisture from air)
educationalNotes: Boiling point 290°C - extremely high! This is because glycerin has THREE hydroxyl (OH) groups, allowing extensive hydrogen bonding. Very viscous, thick, syrupy liquid. Freezes at 17.8°C - can solidify in cold weather. Used in antifreeze, cosmetics (holds moisture), and soap.
